Posts.Content: schristy463 wrote: I found a lump in my breast one night, my husband felt it and yep it feels like a lump to him to. .  I went to the doctor and he felt it and said he does not think it is anything to be worried about.  He thinks it is a cyst.  Just watch and wait and if I feel a change come back.  I am 30 by the way.    He said lumps to be worried about feel hard to the touch, like a bullet.  This did not feel that way to him.  Maybe I should add here that I have lumpy breasts, I don't know if it is cysts or what, but I always have. I actually always thought I wouldn't know a lump if I felt it cause I was already so lumpy, but I did notice it.   Also, my aunt died of breast cancer in her early 50s or late 40s. Now the lump feels bigger to me and to my husband.  Was the size of a pea, now maybe a dime.  It has only been about 3 months, maybe less since I saw him.  I plan to call him back. I was changing insurance and had to wait til I got my insurance cards.  I got them today.  I want to call, but I have fear and anxiety and I know it is better to act quickly, even if to find out there is nothing wrong so I can stop worrying, but I feel like I know that this is bad.   Anyway I am not sure why I am posting here. Maybe just to vent worries to people who have gone through this or are going through it.  Thanks for "listening." Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Right to be worried? schristy463 EGAL
